title: 500 Error at the url root of backend (for accessing Swagger doc)
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->
I wanted to access swagger doc, so I went to `localhost:8000` to login as described [here](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/647#issuecomment-617778961), but it only showed the below message:
```
Request Method: | GET
-- | --
http://localhost:8000/
2.2.13
OSError
Error reading /src/app/server/static/webpack-stats.json. Are you sure webpack has generated the file and the path is correct?
/src/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/webpack_loader/loader.py in _load_assets, line 32
/src/app/tools/../../venv/bin/python
3.6.12
['/src/app',  '/usr/local/lib/python36.zip',  '/usr/local/lib/python3.6',  '/usr/local/lib/python3.6/lib-dynload',  '/src/venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages',  '../api']
Thu, 5 Nov 2020 05:32:51 +0000
```

The same thing happen even when I put basic auth info in the URL as `admin_id:admin_password@localhost:8000`. 

Then, I try to use the auth info directly for the swagger url as `admin_id:admin_password@localhost:8000/swagger`, which showed 403 error.

What's the proper way of accessing the API doc?

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04
*   Python Version Used: I used docker-compose, so whatever the container uses.
*   When you install doccano: 11/4/2020
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker compose local deployment.
